body: English only.
English only. Documents have been there.
3q
Contribution is welcome.

Check the supported-list doc for supported versions. I only found the MongoDB 3.x test cases, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/tree/master/test/plugin/scenarios/mongodb-3.x-scenario. Most likely, there is no one contributed 4.x plugins yet.

Welcome everyone to do so.
I mean, this problem may not caused by MongoDB4.0+, or how can I check the actual reason? So that I can try to contribute 4.x plugins

It could be triggered by other plugins issue. You could try to remove the MongoDB plugin, and give a try. If there is no issue, then, most likely it is the plugin issue. But, as always, debugging is always the best choice.

Thx, I've checked source code and confirm that the reason is plugin incompatibility. 
mongodb-4.x-plugin is needed because SpringBoot 2.3 release switches to MongoDB 4
Any update about this PR?

> Any update about this PR?

Yes, there are still some modifications
Resolved
Oracle plugin is not a part of Apache SkyWalking, it is an ecosystem extension. Please submit the issue or pull request to their repo.
We have two release binaries for es6 and es7, make sure you choose the right one with correct configuration.
Read the document.
@wu-sheng Can I try it? It will be my first contribution in this repository.
@Patrick0308 `help wanted` tag means you could have a try on this kind of issue.
Feel free to go, if you have any issue, send a draft pull request, we could discuss on that.

The error frequency is     SW_STORAGE_ES_FLUSH_INTERVAL
It always exists error!
8.0.1+es7.6.1
how  to resolve ?

Because we will bring a much more powerful on in the 8.1, read this. https://twitter.com/ASFSkyWalking/status/1280479748427329544

We don't simply anything, I think you missed the point of 8.0. All metrics are there, we just organized them in a better way.
use web-flux and choud gateway plugin of version 8.0.1 can resolve this problem

> Contribution is welcome.

I am doing this.

Hi @EvanLjp ,My suggestion is define the configmap with the file name, so that users may know the role of the configuration more clearly. 
Such as：

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37059529/87124560-986a5600-c2bb-11ea-82f8-bf3265c229ba.png)

In the future, I want to add the default configuration file to the helm charts. At present, the default configuration in the docker image seems to be read-only. Could the permissions be modified? @hanahmily
We don't trace static resources on the Tomcat or any other container. Check the `agent.config` -> `agent.ignore_suffix`. We indicate it very clearly in the doc and config file.

@innerpeacez He is doing dynamic configuration, not static config override. So basically, he wants to change this in the runtime. Based on this, the name should follow the document, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/backend/dynamic-config.md. Those names are shared across different platforms.
@innerpeacez The thing you are asking, we could discuss on another issue :)
Oo~~~, Sorry, If it is defined like this, then there should be no need to mount the configuration default files, I will start to test whether these configurations can be mounted in the charts.

@innerpeacez More importantly, once it is changed, the OAP should receive that notification, and behavior should be changed, such as sampling rate. Switching to 10% from 100%(default) should be an easy way to test.
ok, thanks @wu-sheng
What do you mean to design for? The agent is not designed for the Spring only, it is for the Java ecosystem.
@IAMTJW @Patrick0308 I suggest you two could connect directly in private, maybe have some collaborations. Glad to know you both are interested.
Read dynamic configuration documents. This is not about helm installation.
